title: The Acts of Paul and Thecla
subtitle: The Greek Text

verses.english: When Paul was going up to Iconium after the flight from Antioch, traveling companions were with him, Demas and Hermogenes the metal worker; being full of hypocrisy,
earnestly beseeched Paul as though they loved him agapically.
Paul, however, looking only at the goodness of Christ, did nothing bad to them,
but loved them very much paternally,
so that all the sayings of the Lord [and teachings and exposition of the Gospel] and offspring and resurrection of the Beloved sweetened them,
as well as the mighty acts of Christâ€”
how they were made known to him;
in this way he expounded to them.
